Dear Ms. Stevens:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
09/15/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12312 Foster parent training.
(4) At least 1 adult member of the household shall have
training in and maintain a current certification in first aid
from the American Heart Association or the American Red
Cross or other institution approved by the department.
One of eight open foster home records reviewed did not
have a certificate identifying who took the training. The record
had a bill for the training with no name.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Six of 20 updated service plans (USP) reviewed were not in
compliance:
 One USP for 2/5/21 – 5/5/21 completed 5/6/21 was one
day late.
 A second USP for 4/24/21 – 7/14 21 was missing the
report.
 A third USP for 5/8/21 -8/3/21 was missing. Status states
it’s in progress.
 A fourth USP 4/22/21 – 7/20/21 was missing the report.
 A fifth USP 4/10/21 – 7/8/21 was missing the report.
 A six USP for 4/24/21 – 7/22/21 was missing the report.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL 2019 AND INTERIM
2021.

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
ISEP 4.22 MISACWIS (Commitment 22).
DHHS will maintain an operational statewide automated
child welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which will
be the primary tracking system and satisfy federal
reporting requirements.
In several of eight open foster child records, various records did
not show consistent uploads of all signed and timely
documentation such as signed updated services plans, parent
agency treatment plans, updated medical passports and closing
summaries.
REPEAT VIOLATION FROM RENEWAL 2019 AND INTERIM

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
Rule 400.12409 Education policy
The agency is advised to upload the youths school status, grades and school
attending and or performance in the education section in MiSACWIS.
Rule 400. 12413 Medical and dental care policy
The agency is advised that the physician offices are dating the dental and medical
forms sent to the agency when the youth have appointments.
DHHS Policy FOM 801 Medical passport.
The agency is advised to monitoring the medical passports and ensure they are
7

updated.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not offered consultation.
VI. DCWL ANALYST ISSUES ADDRESSED:
Safety Alert
Concern: The relative is having the child sleep in a swing overnight. Crib was
observed filled with numerous items.
Resolution: On 8/31/2021 the foster care worker made a home visit to the foster
home and immediately made a safety plan with the relative. Safe sleep
policy was reviewed and action was taken to clear the bed of all items,
picture is attached. It was explained that if safe sleep policy was not
followed an investigation will be initiated and the child would possible be
removed.
VII. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency completed a special investigation #2021C0420015, initiated on
1/15/2021. The agency was in violation with Rules 400.12505 Supervision and R400.
12208 Job description. A corrective action plan was received and accepted on
3/22/21. It appears the agency is following their corrective action plan.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for their Interim Inspection dated
11/5/2020 and amended 1/27/21. A corrective action plan was received on
11/30.2020.
The agency was in violation with Rules 212 (3) (a), 312 (4), 324 (8), 327 (6) (a), 327
(6) (b), 327 (6) (c), 418 (2) (a), 418 (b), 419 (1) (c), ISEP 4.22, ISEP 6.30, ISEP 6.33,
ISEP 6.49, DHHS Policy FOM 722. 6B, DHHS Policy FOM 722.6H, DHHS Policy
FOM 722.6H, DHHS Policy FOM 722.8, DHHS Policy FOM 722.8C. The agency
overall did better with this Renewal Inspection they did have several repeat violations.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
8

an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that Samaritas - Bay will be
issued a renewal of their regular license.
